meanings.definition: A salt or ester of silicic acid.
meanings.sent1: I learned in science class that silicates are compounds formed from silicic acid.
meanings.sent2: Minerals like olivine and feldspar are examples of silicates.
meanings.sent3: The silicates at the store were all sold out, so I had to buy a different type of salt.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of silicates was as vast as the ocean, each one unique and beautiful.
meanings.sent5: The silicates in the rock sparkled like tiny diamonds under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Any of the numerous minerals consisting of silicates.
meanings.sent1: Geologists study the composition of silicates to understand the Earth's crust better.
meanings.sent2: Quartz and mica are common examples of silicates found in nature.
meanings.sent3: The silicates in the museum were so old, they seemed to whisper stories of ancient times.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range was like a fortress made of silicates, standing tall and strong.
meanings.sent5: As the volcano erupted, the silicates in the lava glowed red hot, a mesmerizing sight.
